title: Tranwell Woods Walking Route

images.title: Gubeon Wood in Tranwell Woods by peter robinson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gubeon Wood in Tranwell Woods

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Roadway at Tranwell Woods
images.caption: Roadway at Tranwell Woods. This old concrete roadway just leads to a field, but is almost certainly left over from the World War II Tranwell Airfield (RAF Morpeth).

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Tranwell Airfield
images.caption: Tranwell Airfield. Tranwell Airfield (RAF Morpeth) was a World War II airfield used for air gunnery training; many Polish airmen were trained here. Although the area has reverted to agriculture, a number of the original structures on the site can still be seen, including this hangar.

images.title: Water tower near Tranwell by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Water tower near Tranwell

images.title: Farmland and hedgerow near Tranwell by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Farmland and hedgerow near Tranwell

images.title: Arable land close to Gubeon Farm by Graham Robson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Arable land close to Gubeon Farm

description: This walk takes you around Tranwell Woods and the old Tranwell Airfield near Morpeth. The woods are located just south of the town, with some nice country lanes and footpaths around the Gubeon Woodland Plantation. The golf centre and the World War II airfield are adjacent to the site. The area is also known for its million pound properties, being one of the most exclusive estates in the North East. To continue your walking in the area head north and pick up the Morpeth Walk where you can enjoy a pleasant waterside stroll along the Wansbeck River. Scroll down for more walks in and around the village.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area head to Plessey Woods Country Park where there's some lovely woodland walking and cycling trails to try.

display_address: Tranwell Woods, Mitford, Tranwell, Northumberland, North East, England, NE61 6AG, United Kingdom
